pr_title: Don't promote transitive dependencies in shaded hazelcast-all

timeline.author: lazerion

replies.bodyText:
@kwart I also see below when we execute mvn deploy
 also see 2 shade executions of sql  module
INFO] --- maven-shade-plugin:3.2.4:shade (fat-jar) @ hazelcast-sql ---
[INFO] --- maven-shade-plugin:3.2.4:shade (fat-shaded-jar) @ hazelcast-sql ---

do we need to do sth for it as well?
replies.author: lazerion

replies.bodyText:
I think we need to add similar fail safe to release automation, I will work on it, please let me know if you see that redundant after this test case.

We should ask @devozerov for an explanation. I think the 2 different shaded artifacts are intentional, but I didn't dig into it to get the reasoning.
replies.author: kwart

replies.bodyText:
In the SQL module we have two executions of the shade module:

fat-shaded-jar - the default Jar with all dependencies merged into the hazelcast-sql.jar, this is what we publish
slim-original-jar (previously fat-jar) produces a JAR that is convenient for the Jet team development process, it is not published (@gierlachg may provide additional details, my explanation could be inaccurate)
replies.author: devozerov

replies.bodyText: Hmm, why it is not published? We rely on it.
replies.author: gierlachg
